intro: Periploca brevicoronata, commonly known as the short-capped periploca, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, often growing in shrubland or rocky habitats. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, while its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
